intro: Acetosella arbuscula, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its rosette of small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. Acetosella arbuscula is also known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
